title.narrative: Improving Postharvest Processing of Sea Cucumbers

description.narrative: Sea cucumbers are worth $20-50 million/year in exports from Pacific island countries; the second most valuable marine export from the region after tuna. Wild harvests provide a source of income to around 300,000 small-scale fishers in the western Pacific. But returns to fishers are less than optimal, largely due to poor knowledge of proper post-harvest handling and processing methods. The aim of this project is to improve the income of fishers in Kiribati, Tonga and Fiji through improving the quality of post-harvest processing. The research will assess which processing methods are adoptable and produce better products and higher market prices. It will also investigate which community types gain most from information and training.
